rules: Rule1: If a journal publishes findings, then that journal is peer-reviewed.
Rule2: Under the condition that a conference features an exhibition, media covers that conference.
Rule3: A conference features an exhibition or a conference features a demonstration.

Rule4: If a conference highlights a demonstration, then, under the condition that the conference features a demonstration, it follows that if the conference schedules an event, it does not cancel that event.
Rule5: If a committee approves a venue, then that committee organizes a conference.
Rule6: A committee approves a venue or a committee selects a venue.
Rule7: If a venue books a conference, then a researcher does not attend a conference.
Rule8: Provided that a venue reserves a conference, that venue books a conference.
Rule9: Either a committee rejects a venue, or, if a committee selects a venue, then that venue reserves a conference.
Rule10: If a researcher accepts an invitation, then a speaker invited that researcher.
Rule11: Provided that a researcher declines an invitation, that researcher does not attend a conference.
Rule12: A researcher chairs a session, or, if a journal does not publish findings, then a researcher does not participate in a panel.
Rule13: If media reports findings, then either media covers a conference or, whenever a conference schedules an event, it does not cancel that event.
Rule14: Under the condition that media broadcasts findings, media reports findings.
Rule15: If a researcher presents a keynote, then that researcher does not attend a conference.
Rule16: A researcher presents a keynote or a researcher presents a workshop.
Rule17: Provided that a demonstration displays a phenomenon, then, if a conference schedules an event, it does not cancel that event.
Rule18: If a demonstration operates correctly, then it is not the case that the demonstration malfunctions equipment.
Rule19: Whenever a technician tests equipment, a demonstration operates correctly.
Rule20: A technician tests equipment or a technician calibrates equipment.
Rule21: Provided that a technician calibrates equipment, a demonstration operates correctly.
Rule22: If a researcher travels to a region, then a grant funds that researcher.
Rule23: Either a conference cancels an event or a grant does not fund a researcher.
Rule24: Provided that a conference postpones an event, that conference does not cancel that event.
Rule25: A conference postpones an event or a conference schedules an event.
Rule26: If it is not the case that, if a conference features a demonstration, then that demonstration displays a phenomenon, then the demonstration malfunctions equipment.
Rule27: If it is not the case that a researcher accepts an invitation or a researcher declines an invitation, then it is not the case that a speaker regrets that researcher.
Rule28: Under the condition that it is not the case that, if a researcher presents a workshop, then that researcher does not attend a conference, that researcher submits an abstract.
Rule29: Provided that it is not the case that, if a researcher presents a workshop, then that researcher does not attend a conference, it is not the case that that researcher submits an abstract.

Rule30: If it is not the case that, if it is not the case that a researcher accepts an invitation or a researcher declines an invitation, then a speaker regrets that researcher, then a speaker insists on that researcher.
Rule31: Provided that a journal does not publish findings, a researcher attends a conference.
Rule32: If a journal does not publish findings, then a researcher participates in a panel.
Rule33: Whenever a journal is not peer-reviewed, a researcher travels to a region.
facts: Fact1: A conference highlights a demonstration.
Fact3: It is not the case that media covers a conference.
Fact4: It is not the case that a committee organizes a conference.
Fact5: A committee does not reject a venue.
Fact6: A speaker does not invite a researcher.
Fact7: A speaker does not insist on a researcher.
Fact8: A researcher does not chair a session.
